inclusion.criterion: Subject is symptomatic for aortic stenosis (AS) or mixed aortic stenosis and aortic insufficiency (AS/AI) disease for which isolated surgical aortic valve replacement without concomitant procedures is indicated according to International guidelines.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Surgery starts with and is intended to be completed via a minimal invasive surgical approach. MIS is defined as a non-full sternotomy approach such as partial hemi-sternotomy, right anterior thoracotomy.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Surgery is intended to be completed with an EDWARDS INTUITY Elite Heart Valve.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Subject has signed and dated the investigation informed consent forms prior to any study-specific procedures are performed.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Subject is geographically stable and agrees to attend follow-up assessments as specified in the protocol and informed consent.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Subject is diagnosed with pure aortic insufficiency.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Subject has Type 0 congenital true bicuspid aortic valve (i.e. absence of raphe and commissures are positioned about 180 degrees apart) or unicuspid aortic valve.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Subject has severe ventricular dysfunction defined as LVEF < 25%. RV pressure was 41 and had biatrial enlargement. EF was 25%.
exclusion.label: triggers
